content.title: Teachers Associateship for Research Excellence
content.beneficiary: Researchers holding a regular academic/research position
content.details: The TARE scheme provides a research fellowship and grant for researchers to conduct collaborative research work at host institutions.
benefits: Research grant of ₹5 lakhs per annum
eligibility: Must hold a regular academic/research position in State Universities/Colleges and private Academic Institutions
Only candidates holding Ph.D. degree in Science/Engineering or MS/MD in Medicine are eligible to apply
Researchers having any funded projects are not eligible to apply
exclusions: Research Associates, Ad-hoc faculties, Guest Faculty, Visiting Scientist, consultant, Project Fellows and Faculty members whose contract is renewed every year are not eligible
Applicants holding ongoing research projects or fellowships at the time of submission are not eligible
content.application_process: Applications can be submitted through eligible Central institutes with relevant R&D infrastructure.

faqs.question: Can I apply for TARE scheme if I am a Co-PI in another project?
faqs.answer: Yes, researchers being part of another project as Co-PIs can apply.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to divide the funding between host and parent institutions?
faqs.answer: Yes, funding must be shared 50% each to host and parent institutions.

faqs.question: Can I choose Panjab University as Host institution for TARE?
faqs.answer: Only central institutes/national research labs and Central Universities are eligible as host institutes.

faqs.question: What is the maximum distance between parent and host institute?
faqs.answer: Distance is not fixed; justification for selection is required.

faqs.question: Is 90 days attendance compulsory to get the fellowship money sanctioned?
faqs.answer: Yes, a minimum attendance of 90 days is mandatory.
